model

Class ParkingLot

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ParkingLot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ParkingSpaceInterface

    public class ParkingLot
extends java.lang.Object
implements ParkingSpaceInterface, java.io.Serializable
    This is the parking lot "bag" that contains the spaces
    Author:
    Matt Guidi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParkingLot(int nCarS, int nTruckS, int nMotorcycleS)
      Instantiates a Parking Lot Default setup is that for every 10 spaces
      8 go for cars
      1 go for motorcycles
      1 go for trucks
      If the number of mandatory car spaces is satisfied
      we fill in the remainder of motorcycles and then trucks

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Space> getParkingLotArray() 
      int spaceFinder(VehicleType vt, boolean skipType)
      Finds the nearest space available based on the conditions
      If the boolean skipType is true VehicleType.CAR can go in a truck space
      Similarly, VehicleType.MOTORCYCLE can go into both truck and car spaces as well
      Once it finds the nearest spot available it returns the index of it
      Space spaceInserter(Vehicle v, int spaceID)
      Space inserter inserts a vehicle into the parking lot array
      Space spaceRelease(int spaceID)
      Releases a vehicle from the space resetting it if given a valid space number
      java.lang.String toString() 
      int vehicleFinder(java.lang.String licensePlate, State s)
      This method finds which parking spot # a vehicle is in

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParkingLot

        public ParkingLot(int nCarS,
                  int nTruckS,
                  int nMotorcycleS)
        Instantiates a Parking Lot Default setup is that for every 10 spaces
        8 go for cars
        1 go for motorcycles
        1 go for trucks
        If the number of mandatory car spaces is satisfied
        we fill in the remainder of motorcycles and then trucks
        Parameters:
        nCarS - The number of car spaces you'd like in the Parking Lot
        nTruckS - The number of truck spaces you'd like in the Parking Lot
        nMotorcycleS - The number of motorcycle spaces you'd like in the Parking lot

    • Method Detail

      • spaceFinder

        public int spaceFinder(VehicleType vt,
                       boolean skipType)
        Finds the nearest space available based on the conditions
        If the boolean skipType is true VehicleType.CAR can go in a truck space
        Similarly, VehicleType.MOTORCYCLE can go into both truck and car spaces as well
        Once it finds the nearest spot available it returns the index of it
        Specified by:
        spaceFinder in interface ParkingSpaceInterface
        Parameters:
        vt - - Enter the actual type of this vehicle for correct placement
        skipType - - If true it allows smaller vehicles to park in bigger spaces, for extra of course
        Returns:
        The index of the best spot available given these conditions. If full return -1

      • vehicleFinder

        public int vehicleFinder(java.lang.String licensePlate,
                         State s)
        This method finds which parking spot # a vehicle is in
        Specified by:
        vehicleFinder in interface ParkingSpaceInterface
        Parameters:
        licensePlate - A string of the license plate provided
        s - The state for the vehicle's license plate for further verification
        Returns:
        Returns the index where this vehicle can be located.
        Returns -1 if not found

      • spaceRelease

        public Space spaceRelease(int spaceID)
        Releases a vehicle from the space resetting it if given a valid space number
        Specified by:
        spaceRelease in interface ParkingSpaceInterface
        Parameters:
        spaceID - This is the index of the space we're trying to empty
        Returns:
        Returns a clone of the space to be used for ticket printing. Null if incomplete

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns a string of the parking lot array's data including vehicle info if not null

      • spaceInserter

        public Space spaceInserter(Vehicle v,
                           int spaceID)
        Space inserter inserts a vehicle into the parking lot array
        Specified by:
        spaceInserter in interface ParkingSpaceInterface
        Parameters:
        v - The vehicle to be inserted into this space
        spaceID - The index in the parking lot where the vehicle is inserted
        Returns:
        Returns the space object that has been modified. Null is returned if Vehicle or ID is wrong

      • getParkingLotArray

        public java.util.ArrayList<Space> getParkingLotArray()
        Returns:
        Returns the parking lot's space ArrayList for other classes
